name: Transatlantic Consumer Dialogue
goal: The Transatlantic Consumer Dialogue (TACD) is a forum of US and EU consumer organisations which develops and agrees on joint consumer policy recommendations to the US government and European Union to promote the consumer interest in EU and US policy making.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Audiovisual and Media, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Employment and Social Affairs, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Food Safety, General and Institutional Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Public Health, Research and Technology, Trade, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives:
EU initiatives and policies in the fields of Food, Intellectual Property, Information Society, Financial Services, Product Safety, Chemicals and Emerging Technologies

Negotiations of the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership (TTIP)
